The room I got was upgraded with the $$ between the ID and credit card trick. Upgrade from a regular room to a suite for $80\/night thanks to Priceline. 

We checked out the pool and gym. Both great amenities for this hotel. The pool had an abundance of loungers with large umbrellas to shelter from the sun. The cabanas could be reserved. Along the outer 1\/3 ends on either side of the pool there was a ledge for you to sit and relax in the pool and get out of the Vegas Summer heat. The pool is very kid friendly. The deepest part was just 4' and each side of the large pool had an area just a foot deep for toddlers to splash and play. I didn't have my kids with me for this trip, but I would come with them here on our next trip. 

In the suite there was a single cup brew Keurig type coffee machine that came with coffee, cream, and sugar next to the machine with to-go cups for your on-the-go morning coffee needs. As well as a mini refrigerator and standard microwave. 

The bed, pillows, and comforter were so comfy. Didn't want to get out of bed in the morning. We had a great view of the strip from our room on the 47th floor. 

The bathroom had a soaking jacuzzi tub as well as standing shower and a TV in the mirror! That was pretty cool. Spacious marble counter with his and her sinks. 

In the bottom drawer of the dresser there is a safe for you to use to keep your valuables free of charge. You set your own code to use it. 

There is no casino in this hotel, but I personally really like that. I like to come back and not have to stroll through a maze of blinking lights and loud sounds as I am trying to wind down for the night. The whole strip has a plethora of places to gamble. I feel not having a casino in the lobby makes the Trump hotel more homey feeling when you get back from a day of activities. Which is really relaxing to me. I would definitely stay here again.

The staff at the Trump was AMAZING!!!  We went there on a "Seasoned" Girls Trip.  As soon as we pulled in, we were shown the red carpet treatment throughout.  Kim met us at our car and helped us get acclimated.  Liza from Concierge was wonderful to work with.  She reached out to me prior to my arrival to help schedule any meals and shows.  So professional and thorough!
The housekeeping staff made sure our room was clean and fridge stocked at all times.  The turn down service was the best.  Pool was amazing and the staff very courteous.  The area was clean and inviting.   My favorite staff of all was the VALET STAFF!!!  Matt, Miguel & Caesar, you made our group feel like we were the freaking Kardashians!!!  Rafael, went above and beyond when driving us.  The entire staff there was sooooo accommodating during our stay.  Each time we drove back our group would say, "Welcome Home." That's how we were made to feel.  We will definitely be returning "Home".

Sorry but not impressed with the Donald's place. It's a decent enough hotel, but could be a decent enough hotel anywhere. In Las Vegas I've come to expect a bit more, and this isn't a bit more. It seems to think it's a 4 star hotel, but I found it to be little more than a LaQuinta with a minibar. I ordered two coffees in the restaurant and was charged $30 for Starbuck's coffee that sells for $5 in their stores. The food at the restaurant was okay, but of medium quality. The room was small by Vegas standards. Overall, it's essentially a LaQuinta, with a Denny's, but at 4 star prices.

The best part was the bathroom by far! jet tub big enough for two, HUGE waterfall shower, and a phone next to the toilet...presumably this last feature was a key to Trump's success! Check in was fast, free shuttle to Caesars and The Wynn...onsite security to keep the riff raff and partiers out. Place was quiet and stress free...and smoke free YEAH!
The only negatives were minor...the giftshop was seriously underthought...I have seen better selection at the kwikey mart. And the carpet(at least on floor 57) was old and needed to be replaced. 
I'll definitely stay here again though, it's right on the strip, next to a mall, and smoke free. Thanks Donald.

I totally enjoyed staying at the Trump towers. We got the one bedroom suite with views of the strip on the 51st floor. It was totally worth it. 

The bathrooms were gorgeous.  A plasma TV in your mirror? Italian marble on the bathroom floor and walls? A huge spa tub with jets? A huge two shower head stand up shower? It was amazing.  

The kitchenette was beautiful, the bed and sheets were wonderful.  My family didn't want to leave the room except to eat. Lol.

I loved that there was no smoking or casino. It Is a pet friendly hotel, so if someone in your party has Hasan allergy, let them know ahead of time.  

OVER ALL A Wonderful Time In A Classy hotel.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for our 1 year anniversary, and it was AMAZING!  Very clean, nice staff, and the bathtub was incredible!  We'll definitely be coming back!! And there is no casino, definite plus!!! And there was a kitchenette!

I was in Vegas for the weekend and booked my hotel stay at the Trump Hotel. Loved it!

The gentleman at the front desk was friendly, courteous and helpful. Especially after the HORRID experience I had just had with Budget Car Rental (to be Yelp'd soon!)! 

I checked in the room and was in love! The room was cozy yet spacious with the following amenities:
Full Stainless Steel Fridge
Flat top electric stove and oven
Dishwasher
Microwave Oven
Cuisinart Toaster and Blender
Williams Sonoma Utensils
Glasses and plate settings
Small Bar area with sink
Counter top with bar stools and seating for 2
Large dining table and "L" Shaped sofa with a fold out bed.
3 total TV's- a 46" Flat Screen in the living area another approx.27" in the bedroom and a final approx. 12" in the bathroom mirror. 
2 Bathrooms- One in the living area with a sink, toilet and shower. The other main bathroom had a dual shower, double sinks, vanity table and a HUGE jacuzzi tub.

I could live in this place! I don't mind the lack of casino as I'm not a gambler. When in Vegas my friends and I are usually trying out the many fabulous restaurants, doing some shopping on the strip and at the outlets or trying out a club\/lounge. 

I thought it was a beautiful hotel, no amazing views and yes it is a bit off the strip amongst a lot of undeveloped land. But I'm not in the hotel the majority of the time and I don't sit gazing out of the window for hours on end. While the view doesn't compare to Mandalay Bay's, the room more than made up for it for me. I had also read here that many reviewers heard trains but I never heard one. Perhaps because it was the weekend? It was pretty peaceful. 

Also to note, we had been out late on Saturday night and when I called on Sunday morning for late checkout they allowed us to check out at 4PM at no additional charge! Awesome! 

Overall a wonderful experience! I just wished I could've stayed and enjoyed the beautiful room longer! I'll definitely be back!

Recently the boyfriend, and I stayed here for our Vegas trip over the weekend.  I would have to say this hotel is def. bang for your buck!  The Trump does not have a casino, and it's strictly a hotel, which is good for anyone like myself that has allergies (no casino smoke!) 

 Ethel, our front desk rep. was very professional, friendly, and extremely informative. She did not leave any important information out, and was patient with us as well.  Overall customer service here is astonishing. 


The room that we originally stayed in was a one bedroom suite, like I had mention before, Ethel the front desk rep. helped us upgrade to a Penthouse suite for a really good deal! Which right away, my boyfriend, and I could not let that offer slip. We took the offer right away! Come on, Penthouse suite?? For just the two of US? Why, yes please! 

Our penthouse  was incredible.  Very spacious, and VERY CLEAN, which included a wonderful view from the 63rd floor.  It was very quiet. Good thing, and bad thing.
GOOD: Can blast music super loud, and no one would complain about any noise. BAD: Very quiet. Kinda felt bad for blasting music, but come on it felt like we had the whole floor to ourselves. All in all it was quite an experience. Will return back in the future. :)

Booked for 179 a night on hotewire, which was nice for a hotel that was just off the strip.  Resort fee made up for the difference between this and a hotel that was on the strip, so that was a lost cause.  Free valet (just like every other hotel).  The rooms were large and clean, the bathrooms had a TV in the mirror, a Jacuzzi tub, and separate toilet\/shower areas.  The bed was comfy, there was a mini-keurig, and the air-conditioner worked (after returning from a trip across Europe, a large room cool room was welcomed).  The stairwell was lonely and the stairs felt flimsy (thin ironwork, paint on wall not finished). The pool area was nice, the jacuzzi in the corner was awesome (glad that it was hidden from plain view), and the drinks were reasonably priced.  Yes everyone at the pool was in shape, yes the music was too loud, but it was still a very nice pool area, and we didn't seem to mind.  I really can't find anything I did not like about the hotel itself.  

The location, yes, about a 5 minute walk from the strip, and the sidewalk disappears if you walk on the north side of Fashion drive. The shuttle runs until 2 Am but only goes to Caesars or Wynn; we took a cab as it was faster and we could go wherever.  Did not try their overpriced restaurant, and did not get to even sit at the bar (which closed at 12 midnight on Saturday night, fail).  Would recommend this hotel if it sat in downtown San Diego or Los Angeles, but in Vegas, you want to stay on the strip, go downstairs to gamble and drink no matter what time it is, and enjoy the view(s).  Will be staying on the strip the next time.
Though I can't stand the man whom this hotel is named after, the place was gorgeous and the service was extraordinary. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we were happy.

This is supposed to be a 5 star facility and although nice, clean, and well maintained, I give it a lower rating because it does not compare as a 5 star facility.  if they said that this was a 4 star facility, I would give it 4 stars.  But for the overselling of the star rating, I must decrease my rating accordingly.

Rooms:  The suites (which were an upgrade) have a kitchen (nice), but no cookware, glasses, or utensils. So what good is a kitchen without any of the amenities.
The suite itself was a great hotel room.

It is slightly off strip directly across from the mall.  So it is refreshing to not have the smoke of a casino.  But strangely, I missed the casino vibe.

The pool was like a regular hotel pool.  Not like the typical extravagent vegas pools.

The gym was ok.  barely enough weight machines and weights.  Nothing to write home about.

More concerned about lawsuits than customer's well being.

Their doors slam like no doors I have ever seen! The door slammed on my wife's toe and she was bleeding. They didn't want to give her an Advil because it would mean that they admit its their fault!

Oh and the resort fee is just irritating!

Great service...sometimes a little slower than would be expected but you won't otherwise be disappointed with it.  Late check-out is 4pm!!  This place does "walk-the-walk" when it comes to Trump's gospel.  The rooms are well appointed.  There is a decent restaurant option on-site, a good spa, and a great benefit, in my opinion, of not having a casino on the ground floor. Also you are located close to fashion show mall, which can be convenient for various reasons.

Speaking of location this is located at the North end of the strip, but if you're in Vegas you're going to do your share of walking anyway.  There is a frequent shuttle to Ceasar's, so you can start your journey from there.  When I go back this will be in my list of top options of places to stay.

Hands down...my favorite affordable hotel in Las Vegas & I would absolutely stay here again.  

I've never stayed at places like Bellagio or the Wynn because it's too expensive.  The Trump is an awesome hotel - you get the luxury for about half the price of other fancy hotels.  

The GOOD:
-The scent!  The very first thing you notice is the wonderful scent in the air...like gardenias.  It is literally a breath of fresh air and instantly takes you away from what you'll normally smell in Vegas - cigarette smoke.

-Beautifully decorated!  Everything is lovely here...all the marble, the gold, crystal lighting, etc.  

-All rooms are suites with kitchenettes!  Rooms have one bed and a pull out sofa.  Nice sitting area, TV and a kitchenette in the standard suite.  Has an electric range, small fridge (great for drinks, water & leftovers), a coffee maker, toaster and microwave.  Cups, plates, bowls and utensils are provided and you can request pots and pans to cook with.  I love that we can keep our own food & drink cold and then reheat if needed.

-The best bathroom!  The shampoo, conditioner & lotion were great...had the same amazing scent as the rest of the hotel & I took them home.  Large & impeccably clean bathroom...shower was awesome, toilet had is own door but walls\/door were translucent; two sinks, giant mirror WITH A TV IN IT!  The bathroom also has a giant jacuzzi bath tub - easily fits two & you can have a relaxing bath while watching TV in the mirror.  This was the absolute best part. =)

-Staff was extremely friendly and courteous.  When checking in, we got a strip view upgrade to the room without asking (yay!).  The security, the doormen, the concierge, the valet guys and the shuttle guys were all so wonderful - never had such great service at any other hotel.


The MEH:
-Valet only; even though valet is free, it's sort of a pain to wait for your car.  Then everytime you get your car, you have to tip too.  I wish there was self-parking although it's not a dealbreaker for me at all.

-Hotel is not on the Strip BUT the hotel is literally across the street from Nordstrom's at the Fashion Show Mall (entrance maybe 50-100 ft. away).  You can cut through the mall and then go out to the strip OR the Trump provides shuttles.  One shuttle travels to the Wynn (the closest hotel) every 10-15 minutes while another shuttle travels to Caesar's Forum Shops every 30-45 minutes.  These actually are very useful.  A lot of times we'd think we would have to walk to the strip but the shuttle was always there to take us - we actually never ended up walking but if we did, it would probably take an additional 10 min. to do so.

-Resort fees.  I hate resort fees...I try to book hotels with no resort fees OR book hotels with internet included in the resort fee (some hotels charge the fee & give no internet!).  Trump's fee is $19.95 per night and includes two bottled waters each day, newspaper, fitness facility, pool, shuttle use & internet.  I didn't mind paying it and getting these things but we only got the paper one day; everything else was available to us. I took all 6 waters and used that shuttle every day, along with the internet.

-Charging tax on resort fees.  Really?  You're already charging me more than the price of the room and you're taxing it too?  I don't think other hotels have taxed the resort fee.


The only real thing that bothered me was the tax on the resort fee but other than that, everything else was perfect.  I loved staying here!  It was a very relaxing stay and without a doubt, I will look to stay here again.

This is my second stay at this hotel.  The first time it was a standard room with a king size bed.  This review is about my 2nd time here where I got the sofa bed.  My friend booked a deluxe room (room# 1710) which had one bedroom with king bed and a fold out sofa bed which was worthless. The mattress itself has springs in it and so worn down that I felt every spring poking me. There was 2 missing coiled spring which attaches to the frame therefore the bed slopped like a sandwich.  I tried for 5 minutes to find a tolerable position before I gave up and just slept in top of the sofa cushions.  This officially was my worst 2 nights of sleep in Vegas ever and I come here twice a year.  Seriously Trump, how do you expect to make America great when your hotel can't provide a decent bed to sleep on.

The trump is a casino less and non smoking hotel (which isn't a bad thing).
Check in was ok, I didn't like the fact they kept on trying to upsale me.
It is a high end 5 star hotel .
I got a suite on the 50th floor facing the strip .
It was a living room + bedroom suite.
Nicely designed and equipped with a Kitchenette. 
It's a short walking from the Wynn (if you wish to play)
The things that I wasn't happy about were the big glass doors to the restroom and the shower that slams every time you close it, that I was actually afraid they will break.
The train does pass by once in a while and it is quite loud. I actually woke up at 2:00 am to the sound of its horn.
I had breakfast in the dining room , the food and service was good.

We stayed here because it is pet friendly, a good deal $120 a night and expecting a very night hotel. We usually stay in another pet friendly hotel under another hotel chain, but the value of that hotel has decreased over the past few years.

Valet parking only. A short walk off the strip, but has free shuttle to the strip. Pet fee is required per stay but provided free bowl, treat and a simple pet bed. 

Very nice lobby and friendly staffs. A man made grass area is available for your furry babies to take care of their business in front of the hotel; turn left and walk for a minute after you exit the hotel lobby.

We booked the most basic room. It is spacious and clean and well decorated. Double door to the corridor that reduce corridor noise. Large bath room with a shower and a jacuzzi. Double sink in the bathroom and bulletin TV in the bath room.

Microwave, electric hot plate, small refrigerator and a sink is in the room. Plates, bowls and utensils are available per request. Great to have to heat our furry babies meals up.

We had a king bed and the room also has a 3 seat-er sofa, 2 single sofa, a decent size desk and a chair; spacious.

Free Internet access (Wi-Fi and Wired).

Valet and in room service could take time which is about the same for any hotels we have stayed.

Otherwise, can't complain.

Sunny

This was our first time staying at the Trump in Las Vegas. From the first moment we arrived and were greeted by valet, to checking in at the reception desk, housekeeping and room service, the entire Trump staff has been exceptional! The room amenities are outstanding, large and we'll appointed. The pool deck is beautiful and relaxing. We would definitely stay given the opportunity again.

I'll make this review plain and simple

The good:
Rooms are spacious, decor is cute, jacuzzi and showers are huge and beds are comfy. Quite, no waiting for the elevator. Mall is across the street, you can walk across and go to the food court. No long lines for taxi.

The bad
No casino, valet can take forever, no nearby casinos, restaurant or bars.  Lobby is pretty empty. The view is boring. You can walk to a next casino, but if your lazy like me, its not fun. Workers seem a bit rude.

Ok,where to start. We stayed for 3 nights Nov19-21 and each night we had a different room, why you ask, because of the faulty switches in the spa tubs. The first handicap room we were placed in had a tub shower combo, the tub did not work at all, the shower head literally came up to our waist. (when I have stayed in other hotels and been placed in an accessible room, the staff has always had the courtesty to ask if this was ok). The tub in this room did not work at all. The next room we moved to the tub worked for about 5 minutes before it was obvious that water was in the switch, not wanting to move again, I thought I will just try again later, maybe the switch will dry out. It did not. We called the front desk and they sent maintenance up who told us they ran out of switches about a week ago??? Finally the third room we got to had an operable unit, but also a cracked swtich so I doubt it will work for the lucky party that gets the room next. Also, there was blue contractors tape in the room, highlighting where things needed to be touched up. The bell stfaf who gave us the keys to this room literally played door bell ditch, handing us the keys and trying to run off without giving us the room number. Several other notes, the parking is valet only which is great expect you get your car back with bird poop all over it. Also I asked the bell staff for champage glasses after our first room move. I tipped him and he said no problem, guess what, never got any glasses. This is a beautiful hotel and my mom and I stayed when they first opened and the service was immpecable. I realize the economy is bad and they have had too do some downgrades, (rooms stocked with less equipment, no water at check in or from valet, no more truffles at night, personal letters or slippers in the room, but you can't be a 5 star without the service. Again, the rooms a beautiful and  you can beat the value, but the service sucks, and moving to a new room daily...not so relaxing. On our final night, at about 1020pm, we srpung out of bed to an alarm from security , with a man on loudspeakers directly into the room announcing everything was all clear, this announcement went off another time about 20 mins later , a little alarming considering we didn't get any previous announcements stating a problem. Was there a fire in the building and we should have already been downstairs, were there armed gunman in the hallways. I know this sounds a bit dramatic  but we honestly wondered these things based on the announcement and when we finally got thru to the hotel operator (phones were jammed) she said nothing other that everything was fine now. Maybe I should be thankful I got out alive.

Very nice if it is just the 2 of you.

The suites do not have more than one bed (the pullout sofa bed does not count).  The pullout bed was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on.  You would think that a place with the name Trump on it would invest in more comfortable sofa beds, especially in a city where more than two people usually share a room.  

They do however try to accommodate you by bringing up extra cushioning for the bed but it does not help, you can still feel the metal bars digging in strange places of your body while trying to lay down. Which therefore makes it impossible to fall asleep, unless you're blackout drunk.

The rooms however are so nice and the bathrooms are fancy as all get up.  The rooms have kitchenettes (Trump was actually going to make these condo's before turning it into a hotel) and the bathrooms have little TVs.

The location of the hotel is right after the Wynn and right before old school vegas starts (i.e.  the sahara, fremont street, stratosphere, etc.). In other words, ONE HELL OF A WALK.

There is no casino here which makes this very classy and less noisy.  The elevators are extremely fast which can make you kind of woozy if you are inebriated.

PLEASE TRY THE CLUB SANDWICH AT THE POOL CAFE! It is so delicious!!

It is one fancy, classy, beautiful hotel.

AMAZING!

Stayed here during our girl's trip and it was so relaxing. We originally booked a regular suite but they upgraded us to a one bedroom suite, which had two bathrooms, a must for girls! It was really nice and clean with a tiny kitchenette.

There's no casino and it's not really on the strip (In my opinion, at least), but at least we weren't too far and the mall was across the street.

We saw Donald Trump walking through the lobby twice over the weekend. That's not why I'm giving his hotel 5 stars (even though it was quite exciting!)

We were offered water & engaged in genuinely friendly conversation when we checked in. (Side note: short line.) Beautiful lobby. 

Accommodating front desk staff. I reserved two rooms & they ensured both were on the same floor & had the correct number of beds I specified. A different front desk gal changed our check-out time from 11am to 1pm without making me feel I was asking for her first born the way other hotel employees make me feel. 

Spacious rooms. Reminded me of condo living with tons of closet space, kitchen counter, sizable fridge, modern art. Comfy-enough beds. Great temperature without having to fuss with thermostat. 

Amenities aren't impressive. Soap left a weird, velvety residue on my hands, & shower gel\/shampoo aren't super high end, but I liked the sleek, black packaging. Large shower. Toilet enclosed in its own glass room. 
 
Fantastic pool! Humongous, less than 4 feet all the way across, warm, clean. Pool area is surrounded by cozy beds & plenty of lounge chairs, but had no showers. 

Loved not having to walk through a smoky casino. 

$29\/day resort fee, a fee most hotels charge now. I assume this fee covers wifi, free water bottles, & the cool keurig machine. 

Located close to the Wynn & Encore & the Fashion Show Mall. Would absolutely stay here again!

Hands down the best experience we've had.
The rooms were lovely, equipped with frig, microwave at no additional charge....game changer.
The staff's recommendations for anything we asked about were TOP notch!!!
The shuttle drivers and valet staff bent over backwards.
For the next trip to Vegas, we'll be at Trump!!

They have extremely perfect room with great city view. The room was clean and luxury. it was on 43th floor!!! They don't have casino or shopping malls, so hotel was really quite. Not really crazy like as other hotels on vegas strip. I liked it. Shopping mall is only 2mins away from hotel. It's soooo convenient at all. And they let me leave my luggage even i already checked out. I picked up my luggage after 15 hours checked out, how lovely it is. One of the best hotels on las vegas strip.

We stayed at Trump last July for a company event being held in Las Vegas. This is a fully non-smoking hotel, no casino, pet friendly, gorgeous hotel. The room we stayed at was beautiful. We book through our travel club booking engine so we got the absolute best price. The pool is small but that was fine. We loved the fact this hotel was off\/away from the strip. Book a room overlooking the strip because the other rooms face away from the strip (overlooking train tracks) but there's a lot of construction going on for new hotels coming to the area. The staff were excellent, friendly, helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want a non gambling, non smoking hotel.

I love how there is no casino in this hotel! its great for kids, it doesn't smell like smoke at all... we had a suite.. and their rooms are nice and clean. Full working kitchen, just make sure you bring your own pots and pans.. hehe!!! only bad thing is that if your room is in the back, you can hear the train at 5:30am!!! soo loud...!!!! so try requesting a room that has the view of the strip! they also have a complimentray shuttle bus that goes to wynn and ceasar palace that comes every 15 mins, thats save you money from taking the cab\/taxis! great ambiance and great experience!

My family and I spent Christmas in Vegas and decided to stay at the Trump because they were pet friendly and had a flat $200 pet fee no matter how many days you stay here. My mom is convinced that the lobby smells like dog pee, but I'm pretty sure it's just the sickly sweet smell of the flowers in the middle of the lobby. There's not very much grass in the immediate area surrounding the hotel, but if you exit the lobby and walk to the left, you'll find a little faux grass area with doggy bags.

Pros:
- No casino, no smoke!
- Suite style rooms with kitchen area (stove, utensils, pots, plates, etc.)
- Pet friendly!
- Across the street from Fashion Show Mall
- Shuttle to Wynn and Caesar's

Cons: 
- Valet parking only-- this makes the turnaround area in front of the hotel super crowded and difficult to access. Protip: Just park at the Fashion Show Mall parking lot across the street and walk...
- Not directly on the strip, but this can be a pro and con, depending on your interests. Plus, the shuttle does help.
- So many problems with our bill:
We noticed a random charge on our bill when we were checking out, so we talked to the front desk about it and they took it off. Got home, looked at credit card statement, saw that we were STILL charged more than what our bill had said. Called Trump customer service and were told that they added a charge back on because they had to tax our pet fee? And they also charged us for an extra day?? But they said they would give us credits for the next time we stay at Trump and that they would confirm this by sending us an e-mail. Three or four days go by and still no e-mail, so we call again and finally figure things out. Way more hassle than it should have been. BUT all the staff who we met at the actual hotel very lovely people.

tl;dr: Nice hotel, decent rooms, no smoke filling the lobby (yay!), location is ok, depending on how close to the strip you actually want to be, but customer service by phone could be better
Luxurious rooms for great prices and super friendly staff! I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends.

I stayed here during my trip to vegas. The rooms were not up to date, the staff seemed a little off, and I wasn't a fan of the cheap looking decor. 
The front desk also confused me and my partner for another guest couple and I felt like I could have stayed at another place and had a better time.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 days on August 18th and I was very impressed with the hotel.

First off, this hotel isn't on the strip.  It's about a 10 minute drive from the strip.  There aren't any casinos in the hotel so it doesn't get as rowdy or crazy compared to the other hotels.  The rooms were very quiet and while staying in the rooms, it doesn't feel like being in "Las Vegas".  

The rooms are big and the bathroom is also big.  Do watch out for the shower area because the floor does get slippery and the warm water takes a while to warm up when taking a shower.  

Breakfast at the hotel wasn't too great, so I recommend going to other breakfast joints around the area.  

Be wary of the resort fee that's mandatory.  It's $25 and it's added to just about all the 4+ star hotels in Vegas.  Pain in the rear end.

Spent my entire birthday weekend from Saturday thru Monday night here with my fiance. We stayed in a studio with a view of the Encore and Wynn hotels. If you want to stay somewhere in Vegas without the smoking and the casino traffic, I highly recommend Trump. 

This place is beautiful! From the very moment the complimentary (might I add, mandatory) valet drives your car away and you step in, you're in complete awe. The beautiful chandeliers, the arrangements, everything. It's contemporary, it's classy, it's Trump Las Vegas. Check in was quick, easy, and soon enough we were on our way to our room. The studio was huge, and the bathroom was gigantic! Jetted tub that can fit 2 very comfortably, a large shower on the opposite end of the bathroom, a mirror with a TV in it (you read that right), and of course your toilet. We also had a kitchenette, with an electrical plate, a kettle, coffee maker, microwave, fridge, etc. There is also a very nice seating area near the window that was great. I just wish they have the larger sofa facing the window so we can see all the lights and the strip! The mattress was very comfortable, king size. 

We ordered room service twice. Both times we received excellent and prompt service! The second time we had called, we had a special request which the employee informed me they normally do not do but granted it to us anyways. Can I say awesome?! They always quoted 30 minutes to an hour, but both times we got our orders within 25 minutes or so. The bottle of wine we had ordered was great, I just wish I could remember the name. I recommend trying at least one from their in-room dining menu if you do stay here.

At the lobby, there is a lounge area with a bar and some pool tables to the side. It has a very intimate feel to it, which I loved especially at night. We did have some drinks and a shot at the bar which were priced decently. Nothing to expensive. The bartender was quick and friendly. They do serve food down there as well but we didn't try any.

If you are driving here, please keep in mind that there is NO self parking. It is all valet, so you may want to hang on to some cash so you can tip. The guys at the valet are really quick and great. When we had been drinking, we had requested a taxi a couple of times instead of our car. Immediately after, we were already in the cab and off on an adventure! Remember, don't drink and drive.

The strip is literally right there, like a couple minutes of walking and boom! The mall is directly in front of the hotel as well. You can see Macy's, Nordstroms, and Forever 21 from the front. Everything is pretty much in walking distance, you may just want to bring some walking shoes. 

Anyways, I hope some of you find my review useful in some way. If you do stay at Trump, have a great time!!

One of the worst hotel experiences in Vegas and I've stayed at quit a few. Hotel is old and worn, we ordered in room pizza and crumbs were still on floor three days later, hot tub was not cleaned, no pool bar, bed is as comfortable as hardwood and hasn't been upgraded in several years, train every two hours will wake you out of a dead sleep and this was just the beginning of the 9 day stretch....still have 5 days left. Finally went to front desk because the lack of restful sleep was taking its toll, their answer was to change to the exact same room on strip side, with a $25 voucher to spend more in their spa. Seriously, this place is not worth the money or effort...

I am currently staying at this hotel but felt so disappointed by my initial experience that I had to write this review.  Bottomline, I will never stay at another Trump hotel again.

Quick summary:
 - Very unhelpful managers.  I had an issue with my booking and I ended up having to talk to the front desk 3 times, Priceline twice. I felt like the manager Maddy was telling me completely different information than Priceline and was trying to make it harder for me to resolve the issue.
- Dated room with no five star amenities
- Rooms with stains on the floors and not clean (for example, the soap dish on the counter had not been cleaned)
- Noisy rooms with horrible views.  They played us on a high floor but with the cheap glass we can still hear the highway noise below us.  Plus, we just have a view of a construction sight.
- Bad location off strip with no nearby casino
- Free WiFi blocks VPN connections.  I didn't realize this and had to spend 30 minutes on the phone with tech support to get upgraded to allow VPNs so I could actually do work.
- No real effort to try to win me back.  I made it plain that I was unhappy with their service and there was nothing done to try to make it up to me.

Obviously, I had a bad experience.  At the root of it was a mistake I made.  I own up to that.  I had booked through Priceline.  I thought I was going to be guaranteed a hotel with a casino, but it turns out Priceline does not do that.  Within an hour of booking it, I called Priceline to see if I could cancel because we really wanted to have a casino where we were staying.  Priceline told me they called Trump but Trump denied the cancellation.  I understand that you get what you get with Priceline, but still, was it really a big issue for them seeing how I had booked it within the hour?  I offered to pay a $100 cancellation, but they said they would charge me the full two night stay.

Ok, so not making sure I was guaranteed a casino was my problem.  But, what happened after that was Trump (and to a degree Priceline's) fault.

I went over to Trump to discuss the case after speaking with Priceline.  After waiting in line, I spoke with a representative.  She informed me that Priceline never called them. She said they would be fine with the cancellation but that it was up to Priceline to refund my money since it was they who charged me.   So, this made me frustrated thinking that Priceline has lied to me.  I called Priceline back but they did say firmly they had called Trump and even gave me the name of the person they spoke with Maddy.  They also said that it was really up to Trump since the money for my stay had already been given to them.  

So, I had to get back in line, and talk to the check-in person at Trump again.  Turns out the manager's name was Maddy, so Priceline did probably call them.  It sounds like Maddy just didn't update my record to reflect the conversation she had with them.  So, this made me look like an idiot when I accused Priceline of not actually talking to them.     Pushing them more, it turned out that yes, it was up to Trump to either deny or allow the cancellation... not Priceline like I was originally told by Trump.  They informed me they would allow the cancellation, but not the refund.  That was actually presented like it solved my problem.  I would be out $700 for the two night stay, but hey, at least the reservation would be canceled.

Again I offered to pay a $100 cancellation fee.  The check-in clerk got Maddy on the line and after some discussion they said they could offer refunding one night, but not both.  So, I would still be out $300.  I have to admit, half of me was tempted to just take the money and walk out because I was so frustrated with this.  But, I really wasn't going to be happy with losing $300.

In the end, I just kept the reservation.  However, I kind of regretted that after seeing the room and the amenities.  This is not a five star hotel.  The rooms are dated, there is a lot of highway noise in the room, the view is horrible (not having strip).  The rooms don't have any of the fancy features you expect from luxury rooms such as USB chargers, spa-feeling bathrooms, etc.

The further frustration was the WiFi.  I had to get work done which required a VPN connection.  When I signed onto the WiFi I just took the normal level access (the complimentary one) .. but it turns out that doesn't allow for VPN.  It turns out you have to pay $3 a day to get VPN access.  Who does that these days?  Not a luxury hotel.  I did go down and ask to at least com'ed the $3 for the WiFi given my experience and how they said they would like to do something for me.  But, then their WiFi setup was so horrible that I couldn't undo the complimentary access to select the business level access.  I ended up having to literally call tech support and be on the line for 30 minutes while they reset the preferences for my IP address.

Checked in to meet my wife. The hotel is beautiful but almost over the top with chandeliers.  The suite is large although had a musty smell due to inadequate ventilation most likely.  Views are good.  Bed is comfortable.  Security appeared to be OK.  Nice bathrooms ( yes there are two).  Lice living area, full kitchen and bedroom.  Oversize jetted hot tub.  The restaurant is sorely lacking.  Nothing special about the menu or food and it is way overpriced for what it is..  You feel like you are dining in an extension of the lobby.  Was unable to be seated for breakfast for over a 25 minute wait because tables were not cleared and bar was full.  The hostess and staff did not seem to be in a hurry to get them cleared either.  As a former restaurant worker, I was appalled at the lack of service and accommodation.  I chose to eat elsewhere.  As a frequent Las Vegas Visitor, trust me when I say, there are much better choices.  I will not be returning to this hotel.  Oh, by the way, I like Donald Trump and even voted for him.  I hope he runs the country better than his hotels.  Have a great day!

I LOVE this place.  What a fantastic find!  Top notch service and the best amenities I've ever seen.  The lobby smells delightfully fresh with a scent of what I thought was jasmine but turns out you can buy the stuff in the gift shop and it's green bamboo.  Plenty of doormen dressed in suits and over-the-top-willing to help each and every time.  Amazing.  Check in was nothing short of perfectly pleasant.  I love that they offer a business center to use for free, which is great for printing your boarding passes.  I love that the shower is about 5x5 with perfect water pressure.  I love that the jetted tub could hold 3-4 people.  I love that there is a tv in the mirror.  The shower and separate pot are behind heavy, slightly privatized glass.  Marble everywhere.  I love the hair dryer; I'm going to get one.  (Andis ionic)  I love the little Subzero fridge, Bosch microwave, and small Wolf 2-burner stovetop.  We had no use for the Wolf, but having had a huge breakfast at Hash House, it was cool to be able to refrigerate the leftovers and reheat for dinner.  There are dishes for anything you might need.  I love the kitchen shears, must find them too.  Our room faced the mountains, Stratosphere, an ugly, seemingly-abandoned parking garage project, and the train (which was not obtrusive at all.  Only heard it a couple times).  I love that there are not door hangers for Do Not Disturb or Housekeeping; there are buttons.  The room was behind double doors that share an entrance to 2 rooms.  This was fine but my goodness, what heavy doors!  Linens were all very nice, good quality.  Toiletries were very nice and were replaced daily, even though not needed at all.  

It is a bit of a remote location on the strip, but not bad at all.  Right across from Wynn and the big mall.  They offer free shuttles to Wynn and Ceasar's if you would like.  The one to Wynn is great, they drop you at the front door, but to Caesar's  you are dropped at the pit of that enormous place and will have a long trek to wherever you are going.  We just got a cab to get back because we didn't want to find it again, in heels after a long night.

All the rooms have 1 king bed.  I was traveling with my niece so would have preferred 2 queens, but she's young and wanted to sleep on the sofa, which she thought was very comfortable.  So it worked out fine.

And to top off a fantastic stay, we were drunk and hung over and barfing from a night of awesome partying (should I have said that?), forgot to reserve the shuttle back to the airport, but the awesome doormen offered a free ride in one of their Escalades (just give a nice gratuity).  THAT was wonderful.  The employees have fun there, love their jobs, and will not hesitate to help you.  

I can't believe the rate was so cheap.  This easily could have been a $500 room.  I'm not sure what their trick is to offer such low prices, but do take advantage of it.  It's a beautiful property with no trashy people, no smoke, and no casino.  I will definitely go back.  There is a $25\/day resort fee that includes all these amenities, plus 2 bottles of Trump water a day, newspaper of your choice, internet, and more.  Love it.

I was initially surprised at the low rates to stay at the Trump. After all, Trump Hotel is considered an upper echelon hotel for most cities and I figured out the reason for the low hotel rates upon my arrival. The Trump is not located on the strip, it sits perpendicular to Encore, the new twin of the Wynn. You can easily cut across the Fashion Mall to get to the strip but if you don't like walking a lot or plan on getting drunk at the clubs, the Trump will cost you many round trip cab rides. The resort fee is ridiculous as well because amidst all the items that the resort fee supposedly covers, the only thing that stuck out to me were two bottles of water every day (not Fiji, it was some generic Trump brand) as well as a towel if you decide to use their pool. There was no turn down service, bar closed at around 11:00pm or 11:30pm and only one restaurant inside the entire hotel. To make matters worse, we had no water to shower the day we arrived for up to 6 hrs due to plumbing work. I understand plumbing issues are out of the hotel's control but there was no prior warning, signs as well as updates as promised. There were also a lot of rowdy teenagers staying at the hotel, it was probably due to low costs.

My first time staying at the Trump Hotel and I really wanted to enjoy every moment of it but alas, there were setbacks.

The Good:
The hotel is immaculate.  The room we had was gorgeous (layout is very similar to The Signature Suites at MGM.  It was a corner 1bdr suite on the 58th floor with a spectacular south facing view of the strip. There's an iPod docking station with an add'tl USB slot... perfect for charging multiple devices.  The hotel amenities were clean, peaceful, and easy to navigate to.  Beautiful pool, that thankfully wasn't over-crowded especially since it was J4th weekend.  A nice sized fitness center... there were plenty of treadmills and equipment... I never found myself waiting to use anything.  The spa was had a steam room and sauna that I was able to enjoy after booking a massage. 

There's a $20 resort fee added on to your bill but in my opinion is well worth it for what you get... 2 complementary bottled waters w\/every housekeeping visit... or you can call and request more water.  Complimentary drop off & pick up shuttle service to\/from the Wynn or Caesar's Palace.  Access to Pool, Spa, & Fitness Center.  FREE WI-FI.

Shuttle service came in handy and saved on cab fare (which means more gambling money!).  However, the shuttle to Caesar's ends at 11pm, so if you plan on staying out late, save a couple bucks for cab fare.


The Bad:
Our beautiful corner suite developed a horrible odor coming from the master bathroom... smelled like mildew.  We called front desk nearly every day to send someone up to take a look.  Turns out there was a leak in the laundry room which is locked off and only available for the owner(s) of the suite.  Maint. came to fix the leak and had to come again to run a wash cycle to get rid of the stale water left in the washer.  However, the smell never left the bathroom.  To prevent it from stinking up the suite, we kept the bathroom door closed and used the second bathroom in the living room to shower and get ready.  It was terrible that we couldn't make use of that huge master bathroom and spa tub.  Unfortunately, no one offered to have switch rooms until the night before we were checking out.  

Secondly, there's a train that passes by on the West side of the hotel near the 15 fwy that you can hear very clearly even from the 58th floor!!  We were in early one night and awoke at 3:30 am to a train passing by blowing his horn!  Rude awakening.


Other things I thought that might be good to know.... 
Pillows are way too soft for me,  your head literally sinks to through... but the bed was comfy.  There is NO CASINO in this hotel... this may be good or bad depending on what you're in LV for.  For the most part, not having a casino downstairs was great for our trip... it was less crowded (especially on J4th weekend) and peaceful.  There was one night I did regret it when I awoke at 4am (thanks train!) and could not get back to sleep.... then would have been a great time to have a casino conveniently located downstairs.  Nonetheless, figure out what you want out of your hotel during your trip before you book a non-casino resort.  Also, not sure if it was just our room, but the volume on the TVs were super super low.  I had to max out the volume just to hear anything.  Kitchenette and full Kitchens have a microwave & stove with dishware & utensils.... so if you wanna save some $$ on grub... walk across the street to the ABC Store inside Fashionshow Mall and buy some pre-made sandwiches, salads, etc... they even sell alcohol and you can store that in the fridge in the room!

Overall, I had a decent experience at Trump.  I'd be willing to give them a second chance to make my experience more happily memorable.

What a joke. The hotel is way off strip. Has no casino. Next to train rails and couple hooker joints. Charges you almost 30 bucks a night resort fee. And offers two eggs and biscuits breakfast for about $20!!??

It's distance to walk to the strip and any decent places makes you feel like prisoner stuck in jail box without anything to do. 

We got couple night through Priceline, but somehow negative or low star reviews do not get posted for the trump - go figure.

One night stay with a terrific room. Poor review due to car trunk and glove box rifled during valet parking which I reported immediately Five days later I received a form letter telling me that safety is a priority for the hotel and a generic apology. Really? Poor customer service.
I get thrown in here quite a bit. Always a good time. If it's not a suite the normal rooms seem to be nice and spacious. Awesome bathtubs. Found myself sleepin in it the last time!

Stayed here for 2 days over the weekend and I absolutely loved this hotel. The lobby is so pretty and the room we had was very clean and spacious. It has a stove,fridge,microwave which is convenient if you plan on using these items. The service we got was wonderful and me and the hubby would definitely stay again! They also have a FREE shuttle that will take you either to the Wynn hotel or Caesars Palace and pick you up from those locations as well. I think for the price we paid it was a very beautiful hotel for a Cheap price. It is a little off the strip (across from Wynn hotel) but I didn't feel it was a big deal since they offer a shuttle. It also doesn't have a casino. But even after all that I still loved this hotel

I wish I could give this hotel 4.5 stars... The hotel smells so wonderful because it is non-smoking and non-gambling.  Awesome!  We checked in after getting lost looking for the self-parking garage (there is none... it's all valet).  The room was huge!  Mini kitchenette included two electric stove burners, microwave, mini fridge, sink with food disposal, and all the utensils, plates, pans, etc.  

The view on the 26th floor was awesome.  Every sunset turned the sky orange.  I have to say, though, that the best part of this hotel was the huge bathroom.  Double vanity sinks, separate private toilet, huge standing shower, and HUGE soaking jetted tub.  It was awesome!  We went for SEMA, so soaking in the tub after walking so many miles was the best remedy.  Also, BONUS TV in the bathroom mirror that you can watch while soaking in the tub.  The shampoo and conditioner they provide is the best I've ever had at a hotel.  My bf loved the conditioner and threatened to use it all himself.  I also loved the hair dryer, which is probably better than the one I use at home.

One minus:  stupid train the goes off every morning at like 3am!

While the Hotel is very nice, the service was not. I usually stay at the Four Seasons for work trips to Las Vegas, and thought I would try the Trump this time. 

I ordered breakfast to my room and receive barely cooked poached eggs (literally, raw) and found a hair in my fruit salad. 

I complained to the front desk, and they took the meal off my bill, only after me having to really explain why I deserve to not have to pay for it. 

Then - I see the meal charge on my credit card. 

Mr. Trump - is this the service you intended to provide?

I will be staying back at the Four Seasons from now on, AND passing the work around to coworkers.

Stayed here a month ago because it's non smoking, even though I hated giving money to Trump. Is across the street from a sex shop, away from strip. Lobby is cold and uninviting. Staff were nice but awkward, perhaps strained by the election. Was uncomfortable with all the Trump campaign merch being pushed in the gift shop. The other guests were of a much lower class than I'd expect to find at a hotel of this calibre. I'm not a snob, but they were loud, crude, had poorly behaved kids... Felt like I was sharing elevators with people who belonged at a Howard Johnson. Nice rooms but won't stay again because of uncomfortable vibe.

This is an amazing place! We stayed here two nights on our way to Utah, and we loved it so much we ended up staying two more nights! 

Rooms
Free and fast valet, and a beautiful lobby welcome you to the place. The elevator is super fast, and the rooms are awesome. The bathroom is huge, with a shower AND a giant bathtub. My room had two queen beds, which were super comfy, along with the average hotel things (safe, mini fridge, etc.).

Pool
The pool is awesome, it is really big so the pool is never really cramped, even on hot summer days. There are plenty of chairs, but it's a little hard to get a good and shady spot. 

Extras
This place is smoke-free, and has no casino, so I'd doesn't reek of cigarettes and is great if you aren't in Vegas for the casinos (and other casinos are a minute's drive away if you are). 
It's dog friendly. This probably can be annoying, but it was good for us since we have a puppy. It's not too big a deal, but as a dog owner, it's hard to find good and dog friendly hotels.
It's really inexpensive. Our room was super cheap, for it being so nice. A great stay!

The junior suite was what I would've imagine my New York posh loft to look like.  It was an amazing room, and if taking the whole bed was free, I would've loaded the car with it right away.

I was at the contemporary suites at the MGM the night before and Trump blows it out of the water.  Not having a casino definitely changes the atmosphere, made it I guess, luxurious.

I was a little skeptical to stay here, but the prices and location were ideal so I decided to put my political views aside and book here anyway. I didn't regret it for one second. AMAZING service from check in to check out. Housekeeping went above and beyond every day. They even organized all my messy hair and makeup stuff in the bathroom for me! Fully stocked us with many extra waters in the fridge and counter. The gals were also super sweet. 

We were originally booked for a deluxe room with strip view but were offered a highly discounted penthouse so we took it. The penthouse would have been almost $3000 if I booked online but 3 nights was just over a grand. Amazing discount and so worth it! The penthouse was GORGEOUS!!! Huge living room, full kitchen with stove, oven, toaster, blender, microwave, full fridge, and even a dishwasher. I felt guilty we weren't cooking! 

I never have great expectations for room service food but my breakfast sandwich was extremely unique and the best room service breakfast I've ever had. My boyfriend said his corn beef hash was the best he's had anywhere, he even ordered it 2 days in a row. 

The pool is beautiful and WARM! It felt closer to hot tub temperature but it was perfect. I absolutely loved staying here. Oh, and the lobby smells amazing. It is filled with fresh flowers and it feels and smells so luxurious. No smoking and no casino which are also huge pluses for me. 

Even if you're not voting for Trump, don't pass this place up just because of him. It is totally worth it.

I stayed here last year in '09 during the Memorial Day weekend with my boyfriend and parents, but keep forgetting to Yelp it!

I got to stay at the Trump Hotel through Priceline after bidding on it.  I think I paid about $150 per room.  It was my first time spending so much money on a hotel, but it really was worth it.  This hotel was by far the best hotel experience for me and I'm still trying to find a hotel that will be just as good or even better. 

The Trump Hotel is off-strip, but not too far from it.  It's actually not too far of a walk to get to the strip, so you don't need a taxi if you're up for a little walk.  The Trump Hotel is everything Trump is ..basically meaning  lavished with gold. Gold is EVERYWHERE.  

I had the studio suite and it was really spacious.  It consisted of a king size bed (omg, SO comfortable and plushy), a flat screen tv, a living room area with a couch and table, and a small kitchen with a fridge and stove.  The bathroom was AMAZING.  Separate jacuzzi tub and shower and a small flat screen tv in the mirror in front of his and her sinks.  I would have been okay just being in Vegas and staying in the hotel room all throughout the trip. =)

The lobby has a very distinctive smell.  Don't get me wrong, it smelled really good!  We stayed when the temperature was so high (100+ degrees), so each time we walked into the lobby, we were greeted with air conditioning and a nice smell..much better than the hot weather and smoke from cigarettes everywhere outside on the strip.

The employees were very professional and nice.  They addressed everyone in my party "Mr." or "Ma'am".  You HAVE to pay for valet parking no matter what, but I was okay with it because we went in and out A LOT.  The valet parking guys were very nice, but we had to wait awhile for our car to arrive..it was okay, since we figured it was due to the Memorial Day weekend and the hotel was crowded).  The bellhop was great - he brought our luggage up right away and placed it wherever we asked in our room without any hesitations.  On our second and final night there, I asked the concierge for suggestions on events taking place.  She was very informative and suggested a lot of great places.  They also have an employee outside the elevator in front of the lobby to make sure only Trump hotel guests were allowed in for safety precautions at night.

Overall, a GREAT experience.  The Trump Hotel definitely shows other hotels what great customer service is all about.

3.5 stars

We stayed here for the weekend and it reminded me of The Signature Suites at MGM.  At least the layout was similar.   Obviously Signature is nicer in every aspect and the rooms are larger but for the price Trump is a nice place to stay.

Room service was quick and I was happy with initial cleanliness of the rooms.

So I gave it a 3.5 star because:  I've stayed at a lot of the hotels in Vegas and this wasn't Wynn quality (5 star), Aria (4 star), TI etc (3 star), Luxor (2 star).

Bottom line:  Would recommend!

My stay at Trump was aight. That's not even a word, but it's fitting because Trump isn't even really a Las Vegas hotel.

Granted, that's kind of what I wanted. I don't gamble (gasp!) so Trump appealed to me as a place where I could get away from the madness. 

The lobby is beautiful and I had a high floor room with a nice view of the mountains. Whatever, I paid $75 for the room so I wasn't expecting the Strip view. One weird thing was that I shared a foyer with another room: you accessed the door to the foyer with your key, then you accessed one of the two room doors again. I shared the foyer with a group of dudes getting their party on but luckily there wasn't too much noise. I didn't exactly feel unsafe but it was just an odd configuration.

Parts of the room, like the mattress that was 8 inches too short for the bed, were totally half-assed. Yeah, I work in the industry so I probably notice cheap carpet or unfinished elements before other people but only the most cracked out of guests (or the person who signed off on the furniture order) would miss the Grand Canyon at the end of the bed.

The empty lot next to the hotel is sketchy at times... As we were walking the 5 minutes from the Strip to the hotel at 10PM one night I remarked to my companion that this was the perfect place to get mugged. I was fine in the daytime but take a cab after dark.

The night of my arrival I was starved after not eating for 12 hours so I ordered a $20 burger from room service. It was terrible and I would have been better off eating that squished granola bar in my carry-on bag.

All staff was friendly - no attitudes here.

Super fast WiFi - probably the fastest I've ever experienced in a hotel - but it better be fast since that was basically the only amenity that I used that was covered by the $20\/night resort fee.

All in all a decent stay as long as you know what you're getting into.

I was expecting to be more impressed, but ended up incredibly disappointed with the customer service and proximity of the hotel to the strip.
When I checked in, the representative was getting over a cold and kept wiping his nose after he turned around to sneeze. You can imagine how thrilled I was to get the contaminated key cards he handed me.
The room was so-so. All of the plates in the kitchen were dirty, which proved to be a hassle when I brought home a take out pizza.
The super-bright lights that light up the tower from below are way too much of a nuisance, even at the 30th floor level. Even the blackout curtains don't block out the light.
To get to the strip, you have to walk across a dangerous cross walk and then walk through a busy mall. Give yourself at least 20-30 min. to get to the closest hotel\/casino on the strip, Treasure Island.
The one plus was free valet parking for my guests.

It's great there's no casino to trek through with all your luggage & there aren't a bunch of drunk weirdos hanging around. The rooms are large have a nice little kitchen & great jet bath tub with TV in bathroom mirror. The rooms are quiet on the top floors away from the outdoor pool where you can hear music from. The maids were very loud & yelled up & down the hall even though there is a vestibule between the rooms & hallway they prop the doors open with their carts & are not considerate of guests sleeping. Unfortunately this is typical in hotels. There's a train that runs by the hotel all night every couple hours blowing it's horn! I downloaded a white noise app on my iPod the second night & slept much better! The beds are comfortable & the complimentary water & coffee were great. The valet parking is free but tips are strongly suggested & expected which adds up quick!! You aren't allowed to park yourself & it'd be great if you could in the parking structure. Call ahead to have them bring your car.
Great staff beautiful property and check out the resturrant DJT you will enjoy it. The concierge at the Trump a very helpful.

Beautiful. I LOVE the scent of the hotel. And I love when at 2am - you're sloshed, walking barefoot carrying your 3 in heels, and they just smile at you as you enter the elevator bank. 

Only issue is that the pool is plain, and full of old white couples.

Wasn't sure about staying here as it's a non casino hotel and a bit far from our convention at the MGM. However, the non-smoking hotel aspect of it was huge and well worth the slight inconvenience. Lyft and Uber only cost $5 each way and since parking is free it ended up saving me money. 

Our room was on the 29th floor and let me tell you - other than paying astronomical prices for penthouse suites, this room was by far the nicest I have ever stayed in. The showers (yes, we had 2 bathrooms in our room) were spacious and we even had a full kitchen with oven, refrigerator, dishwasher (insane) and washer\/dryer. The soaps\/shampoos smelled amazing and the employees were friendlier than any other Vegas hotel I've ever stayed in. 

Finally, nothing but amazing comradeship with other guests. Had a blast meeting people from all over the globe who support the man behind the name. Typically I can't stay in Vegas more than a couple of nights. I could have stayed there for weeks. Loved every bit of it.

So we went to Surrender at Encore and were trying to catch a cab but the line was ridiculous so we decide to walk across the street to the little strip mall...bad idea no cabs...trump is the next closest so we proceed on our journey mean while the trump shuttle busts a U and says are you guys going to the Trump.  Why yes we say who doesnt love a free ride.  We get there he hooks us up with a suburban and drives up back to our hotel all for free.  We tipped him about $40 for his help but u cant beat that service.  I think the shuttle driver gave him the impression we were staying there and we didnt confirm nor deny.  But talk about service. Will def consider staying here next time!!
This hotel is nice. The staff is quite attentive, rooms were top-shelf, and it's right across the street from Fashion Show Mall.

My new favorite hotel in Vegas. Service is unmatched. No crazy casino, people, smoking... It's so nice to go get wild and come back to a wonderful smelling calmer spot with no hassles of getting lost trying to find your room. I love this place. Free lazvazzo coffee each day, rooms are clean, bathrooms fantastic! Plus a shuttle to Caesar or Wynn every 15 minutes!

Hands down, the BEST hotel I have stayed in in Vegas. Possibly anywhere. If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would.

First, the only parking is complimentary valet parking. Which is awesome. And makes you feel pretty legit, especially when you're not swanky enough to usually valet park your car. 

The girl that checked us in was very nice and very helpful. She made light conversation with us and was very polite. All of the staff that we came in contact with were the same way. And I really appreciated when we came in late one night, that they were checking everyone's room keys before they could get on the elevators. 

The hotel lobby was beautiful and well-kept. I really appreciated that there wasn't a casino attached because it made everything look that much classier and nicer. 

We just got the standard room but it was HUGE. King-sized bed, more closets than I have in my house, a kitchenette with a sink, mini-fridge, toaster, etc., and a sitting area with a couch and two chairs. And the BATHROOM. I have never in my life seen a bigger hotel room bathroom. A shower that could have easily fit ten people, a walled off area for the toilet, double sinks, a HUGE jetted tub, and a TV IN THE MIRROR. I felt like a queen. 

The only problem we had was the reception on the TV. About every three minutes, the picture would freeze and would stay that way for another minute or two. But when you're in Vegas, you don't spend much time laying around watching TV, so it wasn't a huge deal. 

I fully plan on returning to this hotel whenever I'm in Vegas. And I HIGHLY recommend staying here.

Can't give this place 5 stars.  On top of the room fee, they charge a $28 daily resort fee... their pool is ordinary, the gym is nice, the room is very nice but that's all... nothing extraordinary.  Two cups of nasty coffee are provided in the room, after which you have to get a $6 cup of coffee take-out from the lobby restaurant.  No robes in the closet.  Yes, there's a TV built into the mirror in the bathroom, but it doesn't have speakers (so what's the point?).  I had a $55 pedicure in the spa, and my toes looks good - but my toes look good after a $22 visit to Happy Nails.

Aside from my political opinion - this hotel has no casino and a bar tucked away in the back. Nothing about it is inviting (especially the guys who appear to be security?) I am not impressed at all with this. I mean why make this big huuuuuge building near the strip and not have any gambling or drinking? I found it to be incredibly lame and will not be going back and suggest unless you need to sleep and want to overpay for that - then I'd avoid as well. The location is on the fashion show mall drive right near Sammy davis jr. drive.  There are some pretty unsavory characters on fashion show mall drive after midnight so you're gonna wanna watch out for that as well.

If you need a place to stay that does not have gambling per se, but you love shopping this is the perfect place. It is gorgeous. The rooms are fairly large. Nordstroms is right across the street. The only bummer is the train at night can be heard from your room.

Hi I am really disappointed with MR Donald trump point of view about the Mexican people. I am Mexican I stayed at his hotel one week twice a year . I ask the Hispanics to boycott his business like this one  . Con esos comentarios racistas que el senor donal trump iso sobre Los Mexicanos. No le des Tu dinero a jente como Donald trump

So my group of friends and I decided to take a chance with this hotel after seeing that I could save $100+ per night compared to the other 5-star hotels on the strip, i.e. Wynn\/Encore, Palazzo\/Venetian, Caesar's, the City Center Hotels, etc. 

The hotel is located about a block off the actual strip, just down the street from the Wynn and Encore. In fact, we had a very nice view of the two hotels from our window on the 17th floor. Our group figured it would be best since we planned to club at XS on both Friday and Saturday night of our stay. Luckily for us, the hotel provides a round-the-clock shuttle to the Wynn that arrives every 15 minutes or so that will take you on a 5 minute ride down the block to the Wynn. Unfortunately for us, this service ends at 2am, so if you plan to stay at the club til it closes, you'll have to cab your way back since the ladies aren't about to walk back to Trump in their clubbing shoes.

As for the hotel itself, it was very nice. Fancy enough compared to some of the others but again, I didn't think it compared to some of the nicest "true" 5-stars in the area. If you've stayed at Aria, Vdara, Cosmopolitan, Venetian, and Palazzo, you know what 5 stars is like!

Parking is valet ONLY which for some should be a convenience, but was annoying for me because I had to tip every time I picked up my car and depending on the line, had to wait also. Our room had one king bed + a sleeper sofa (no double bed + sleeper sofa option available!), the sleeper had no sheets, and we were missing an iron+ironing board and had to call 5 times for them to bring one. Despite this, the room itself was very clean and the big king bed was very comfortable. Bathroom featured frosted glass doors for the shower and the toilet area so you could be going about your business if other people wanted to use the restroom at the same time to wash their hands, do their hair, etc. at the vanity. Not something you should do most of the time, but when everyone is trying to use the restroom at the same time to get to the club in time, you gotta do what you gotta do. Also, no casino or buffet downstairs was something of a negative in case you want to go down for a quick meal or to gamble a couple of bucks away. The positive side of this is that you don't get all the noise, sounds, and smells of having those things downstairs. Didn't get to see or use the gym or the pool area, but they did look nice in pictures. 

Would I recommend this place? If there are only 2 or 3 people in your group, this is a perfectly good place if you don't mind the distance and don't mind not having a casino or buffet downstairs. For the younger crowd that comes with an entourage, I suggest skipping this place and forking over the extra money for a nicer place with 2 double beds and the sleeper sofa. 

So overall...
The good: Bargain price compared to the other 5-star hotels, comfortable basic room is perfect for 2 people, 3 at most. For a bigger group, opt for a 1 or 2-bedroom suite. Quiet if that's what you're looking for in a Vegas hotel. Tacos El Gordo just down the street! Very good for late night munchies.
The bad: Valet parking only was somewhat inconvenient, not super close to other hotels\/resorts, no buffet or casino downstairs, no options for 2 double beds - one king bed only in a regular room.
The ugly: 5 calls to get an iron in our room - not cool if you have to iron your clothes before clubbing!
Rooms are very nice but service was horrible. Supposed to check in at 3 but kept me waiting until 5.

I booked 4rooms for myself and friends for this weekend. Rooms are clean and well kept. For a hotel that caters to businessmen and professionals, it sucks to find that d rooms do not even have a single pen to use for note taking. The internet sucks. The cell phone reception is very bad. The worst part are some of the front desk people who seemed to be lacking with training in dealing with clients with the exemption of two personnel - Lonnie and Mikael who were very helpful and attentive to resolve whatever concerns presented to them by their guests.

Trump Las Vegas was a really nice hotel to stay at. The ONLY downfall is that I spent most of my time trying to get to the middle of the strip. The hotel is located across the street from Nordstroms at the Fashion Show shops. I spent a lot of my time at the Wynn, Caesar's, and Palazzo. You think it's just across the street but when you actually do the walk in the Vegas heat it seems like miles. The shuttle service was really nice, but only took us to Wynn and the back of Caesar's Palace shops. 

I actually liked the fact that this hotel didn't have a casino. The hotels with casinos all smelled like cigarettes, especially Harrah's. It was nice to go back to a clean and smoke free hotel. 

The pool area is a bit small but it didn't bother me so much. My one complaint is that there are limited umbrellas. So, if you want to relax without the sun blazing on you, you have to grab the umbrellas fast. However, I did like how cold the pool was. I was expecting a luke warm pool because of the heat but was surprised that the water was actually pretty cold!

I was in a spacious one bedroom city-view suite but the "city-view" just means the view of the liquor store and construction. This might bother you if you're into getting the "good view". So try to avoid "city-view" and try and get the "strip-view".

I probably won't stay here again because I want to be literally ON the strip so that I don't need a shuttle or taxi. But, I would recommend it for people who don't mind taking the shuttle or taxi to get to the middle of the strip. It was clean and the staff was very friendly.

WOW!

This place is amazing!! I stayed here with a girlfriend during a trip to Vegas and was extremely pleased with how nice this hotel was (although, I guess that should have been expected since its a Trump Hotel).  The room I stayed in had a King bed with a pullout bed in the couch.  The bathroom was the size of my bedroom at home and I seriously could have slept in the tub, it was that big,  The room was modern with a small kitchenette and was well furnished with simple, yet elegant furniture.  What I liked most about this hotel was the fact that it didn't have any casinos or nightclubs in it, which helped add to the feeling of luxury and exclusivity,  

The only thing I didn't like that much was the fast that the shower and toilet were separated by glass window panes.  I didn't like feeling like I was on display if someone walked into the bathroom, but considering I shared the room with another girl, I guess it was okay.  Furthermore, something else I've never experienced before were staff members asking to see my room key to make sure I stayed at the hotel.  Obviously, its not a problem since I had my room key on me at all times, but it definitely felt a bit intimidating.

I love my trips to Vegas and can't wait to come back again, but the Trump was a bit too pricey to use on a regular basis.  I'd rather stay at a cheaper hotel on the strip, but wouldn't mind staying at the Trump again if I won the lottery.

I stayed here in March for 4 nights.  The room was clean and there was plenty of space. Bed was on the firm side, but still comfortable enough to get quality sleep.  Bathroom was also large and included a tv in the mirror and a jacuzzi tub with jets that could be adjusted to different 3 speeds. The toilet was separated by a frosted glass door within the bathroom.  Next to that there was a shower in a separate stall.  The view of the strip from the room was nice. There was a mini kitchen area which came in handy to store leftovers and chill drinks.  Only thing that was inconvenient was that you have to call if you want any kitchen supplies. There was a sign that explained there was a law that prohibits them from storing them in the room. Two complementary bottles of Trump water were supplied daily which came in handy since the weather was dry.  There was also a K-cup coffee maker and Lavazza Perfecto cups that were restocked daily as well.  I didn't really like the scent of the supplied soaps and shampoo since it was musky, but it was not a big deal for me since I brought my own. Location is directly across the street from the Fashion Mall which you can cut though to get to the strip.  It takes about 10 min to walk from the hotel to the strip.  Check in and check out went smoothly. I booked here through hotels.com which saved me some money since there was a promotion on that website and cash back via ebates.

Ok, short but sweet.  The place was really nice.  Mandatory Valet kinda inconvenient but OK.  Mall across was nice.  Not a lot for the kids to do otherwise unless you drove into town.  If I had known it was pet friendly I would have had my dog.  

BUT

(and it's a big BUT) How come nobody here has complained about the continuous train horn blowing at 11:00 PM, 12 AM 1 AM 2AM 4AM and 6AM until you wanted to just scream WTF!  It was horrible.  45 floors up and it was just like someone left the tv on full blast right by your head.  

No wonder they couldn't sell condos and had to make this a hotel.  Nobody could live there!  Maybe if you had a strip side room it wasn't so bad, but jeez, 2 nights there and I was definitely ready to go.

I will never stay there again -- thank you hotwire for giving this place a 5 star and ruining the North Strip 5-Star Wynn\/Encore listing -- NOT.  

There's a reason Hotwire won't let you post reviews about this place on their site.

I arrived at the trump to hear that they over booked and want to refund my money and put me up in another hotel. 
So why not right. I didn't know that the manager that promised me that really didnt intend on refunding me my money. 
Basically I had to talk to an array of people to even attempt to get my money back. In the end all they wanted to do is give me another night stay. I had to call my bank to get my money back. Worst experience in a long time. I will never stay at the trump.

This hotel is pretty amazing, very fancy and luxurious. The staff from the front desk all the way to housekeeping were very pleasant and accommodating. Valet took a little bit long to get our car in and out, causing us to wait in that very cold wind tunnel for a long time. I wish we would be able to call valet from our room to get our car out from the garage and just come down and pick it up. But overall, it was an excellent day.

Absolutely beautiful.

This is what all hotels should be.. flippin' huge tubs, fancy shmancy tv installed into the mirror of the bathroom. huge comfy bed. full kitchen (although there aren't any pots, pans or utensils for you to use on that stove), and super friendly staff. 

No casino here, thank god! No smokers puffing clouds of nicotine smoke all over the air. A little off the strip, but right across the street from  Fashion Mall.

Here is a letter I wrote that explains it all;

To Whom It May Concern,
We have been staying at the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas since November 22, 2012 and have regretted staying in this supposed 5 star hotel since our first 20 minutes after checking in. Our first room, 4717, had missing handles on desk drawers, clogged jets in the jetted tub and the bathroom door had to be slammed in order to close. My partner accidentally locked the bathroom door and we had to call the front desk to get someone to unlock it, which took a few calls until someone finally came. He noticed the condition of the door and said he would have to remove it and they offered us a new room. When they sent up a bell hop to give us our new keys he gave us wrong directions on how to get to our new room sending us waltzing around the 34th floor looking for an elevator to take us to the 25th floor.
